text: Rev. Dr. Christopher H. Boylan, DD, was an Irish Priest who served as Rector of the Pontifical Irish College, Rome. A priest in the Diocese of Meath, Dr. Boylan was professor of Hebrew from 1816Kalendarium Maynooth Maynooth College and was a Professor of English Elocution from 1818, and jointly professor of English Elocution and French Language from 1820Royal Commission on Irish Education : eighth report with appendix (Maynooth), 1827. in St. Patrick's College, Maynooth. Dr. Boylan was appointed by Bishop Daniel Murray to succeed Dr Michael Blake as Rector in 1828, and he was succeeded by the future Cardinal Dr.Paul Cullen, shortly afterwards in 1832 due to ill health Dr Boylan returned to Ireland, and died shortly afterwards.'Paul Cardinal Cullen and the Shaping of Modern Irish Catholicism' By Desmond Bowen. ==References== Category:1789 births Category:1832 deaths Category:Irish Roman Catholic priests Category:19th-century Roman Catholic priests
